intro: Torilis infesta, commonly known as the common hedge mustard, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are alternate, lobed, and often have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and erect. Torilis infesta is an annual plant that blooms from spring to early summer.
